bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. PETRI:H.R. 4148.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 of the Constitution.[Page H1209]

item.title: Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway National Heritage Area Act of 2012

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on National Parks. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 112-578.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E319)

summary.text:
Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway National Heritage Area Act of 2012 - Establishes the Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway National Heritage Area in Wisconsin.

Designates the Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway as the local coordinating entity for the Heritage Area.

Requires the Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway to prepare and submit a management plan for the Heritage Area.

Sets forth requirements for the approval or disapproval of the management plan.

bill.title: Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway National Heritage Area Act of 2012

item.title: Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway National Heritage Area Act of 2012
To establish the Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway National Heritage Area, and for other purposes.
Fox-Wisconsin Heritage Parkway National Heritage Area Act of 2012

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
